alert.note: Alert for Magoffin (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 10 at 11:08AM EST until January 10 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Kentucky... South Fork Kentucky River at Oneida affecting Clay County. Cumberland River at Williamsburg affecting Whitley County. Cumberland River at Barbourville affecting Knox County. Licking River near Salyersville affecting Magoffin County. For the Cumberland River...including Cumberland, Baxter, Pineville, Barbourville, Williamsburg...elevated river levels are forecast. For the Kentucky River...including Whitesburg, Hazard, Jackson, Oneida, Booneville, Heidelberg, Ravenna...elevated river levels are forecast. For the Licking River...including Salyersville, Morehead...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Licking River near Salyersville. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Water inundates one lane of Kentucky Highway 1090 in a few places near Lakeville. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 PM EST Sunday the stage was 13.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 14.5 feet this morning. - Action stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued 6 pm EST this evening.
